page.title: 18The People of Stone
page.content: The main centres of population are the St Michael's and Christ Church parishes which have about 12,000 people.Not all of this area is included in our survey. Most of these people live in areas at each end of Stone High Street and at Walton. Near to St Michael's Church and Christ Church there are old Terraced houses. At the St Michael's end of the town there are two council estates.Large private houses are to be found in Lichfield Road, Newcastle Road, Airdale Road, etc.Near to Christ Church there is sheltered accomadation for old people.These bungalows have a warden in attendance. The village of Oulton has over 1,000 inhabitants.The centre of the village has a school, church, inn and older houses.On the outside of the village are to be found newer houses. In the country nearby are many farms.
